posts.title: Feds accidentally publish secret plan to kill NYC congestion pricing
top_comments:
>The internal 11-page letter, sent from attorneys in the Southern District of New York to a lawyer for the federal transportation department, was taken down less than an hour after it was erroneously put online.

Uh…you can’t put the toothpaste back in the tube.
Anyone know how to be deleted from Signal group chat, I keep getting added
States' rights, except for those we do not like, amirite?

The one good thing about this administration is they are so unbelievably incompetent.    

Imagine the damage they were just as sinister AND competent.
I had to double take that it didn't say congressman.
I knew all about this.Someone named Pete texted me about this yesterday! I don’t know how I got on that text chain but I think the poster is pretty tipsy;)

Trump's whole argument is BS.  He only cares about congestion pricing because he wants to hurt a blue state.   If Trump really thinks tolling interstate highways is illegal then what about Florida, New Jersey and Texas collecting a combined $5,000,000,000 annually in "unfair" tolls on interstate highways that we paid to build with tax dollars?   The Pennsylvania Turnpike was built and paid for 50 years ago and they still keep collecting those tolls.
Fitting for an administration that destroys everything and accomplishes nothing.
Their administration is so chaotic and unorganized that they can’t keep anything a secret it seems
I'd love to say this is shockingly incompetent, but it's just par for the course at this point. Thankfully their stupidity undercuts the effectiveness of their authoritarianism a bit.

posts.title: Rwandan genocide leader living in exclusive New York enclave arrested for alleged immigration violations
top_comments: That's exactly the sort of visa fraud that we want the government to look into.
NYT did an [article](https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/14/nyregion/nyregionspecial2/14libee.html) on him in 2006 without knowing who he really was
He’s lived here for over two decades, financed how?
Finally, the Trump admin arrests someone for immigration related fraud that deserves to be arrested and deported.
Why do I get the feeling this one isn’t going to El Salvador…

*“As alleged, Nsabumukunzi repeatedly lied to conceal his involvement in the horrific Rwandan genocide while seeking to become a lawful permanent resident and citizen of the United States,” said United States Attorney John Durham.*

He's facing a 30 year sentence, which in no way matches his crimes.  He is not, in any normal sense of the word, an immigrant.
Looks like ICE needed some good press.
While I wish his ass would go to a gulag in El Salvador’s, they should deport him back to Rwanda

"He was arrested Thursday and accused of concealing his role in horrific violence and human rights violations by making false statements in his applications for a visa, green card and for U.S. citizenship, according to the Justice Department."

Finally someone is deserving to rot in El Salvador. Unleash the full might of ICE on this creep.

I am really skeptical the feds *just* found out about this after all this bad press for ICE lately. It seems like there were sooooo many opportunities to learn this over the last 20 years. I wonder if he’s been an informant or there was some other reason they let him stay. And ICE needed some story to put them back in America’s good graces and went after the guy they knew was here and decided no one would care if this guy is deported (I certainly wouldn’t, provided due process happens).

posts.title: Texas creates its own DOGE in attempt to make the state more business-friendly
top_comments: What is it going to cut?  Republicans in Texas have been in charge of the budgetfor decades.
Isn't Texas one of those states that's been controlled by republicans for decades?
Gross. Texas proving once again that it's a total shithole
The irony of signing a bill for "government efficiency", while using dozens of different pens to hand off as souvenirs for your corporate masters
Texas can't even keep their power grid functioning 🙄 cuts to spending should be the last thing on their mind
Business friendly = human miserable
Is business friendly the impression they got from this? Wow
So you have a federal level DOGE and a state level DOGE? That sounds like inefficiency to me, one of them will have to go.

So let's talk this thru, with beef as an example:
 
The state that produces more beef than anywhere else is going to cut regulations on businesses, giving free rein to bad actors.

They will also eliminate (I'm assuming) any current protections they have for immigrant workers, as they turn said workers over to ICE for deportation driving even legal workers out of the state. 

At the same time, the FDA will no longer be performing quality checks, and will be understaffed to respond to incidents. 

Also, the CDC and other health agencies have been effectively muzzled on what they can share with each other or the public.

**In conclusion**: Texas is inviting cattle ranchers and slaughterhouse operators to build or expand, with little to no regulation. Cattle will be kept and fed less safely. Slaughterhouses and beef packaging plants will be understaffed. There will be no government oversight to ensure meat is not spoiled when packaged or stored unsafely. When inevitable outbreaks occur, recalls will be less likely. Then the FDA and the CDC cannot tell consumers about the danger if there is an outbreak, anyway. Widespread illness and death occur.  BUT, at least business owners and politicians made more money. And I become a vegetarian.

Businesses and tech can come crawling back to CA. I expect your tail between your legs, but happy to have them back (also, for anyone who thinks CA isn’t doing well, we’re now the 4th largest global economy… up from 5th)

posts.title: After a scathing rebuke, judge grants DOJ an extension in deportation case
top_comments: Yeah, sounds about right. Absolutely worthless.

To be clear, the lawyers representing Abrego Garcia *also* signed off on this pause. We don't know *what* the deal is, but the Trump administration floating something that apparently offered the possibility of resolution. We'll see what ultimately happens, but I don't think this is actually *bad* news, per se.

>"Defendants have failed to respond in good faith, and their refusal to do so can only be viewed as willful and intentional noncompliance," Xinis wrote.

>"That ends now," Judge Xinis declared as she rejected the administration's arguments so far as "specious" and condemned their "mischaracterization" of the Supreme Court's directive to facilitate Abrego Garcia's return to the U.S.

Judge Xinis should have clarified, "That ends...in another week". What a joke.

Because people are reading the headline and nothing more, she gave them a week because KILMAR'S ATTORNEYS AGREED TO IT. The government's attorneys filed something under seal, Kilmar's attorney replied to it, and then both sides agreed to push back the deadline a week.

A delay for what? We have Congress people going there. We have the creepy President of El Salvador coming here. We have Trump making many statements about how he refuses to comply with the Supreme Court. Do we just not care that democracy is dying? The man that our government said was mistakenly sent there, paid for by the US to be kidnapped and jailed in that country, could be back here tonight.

Soooo, “That ends now” meant…what, exactly?

For fuck sake - either just let this man turn into Hitler reincarnate or don’t. But fucking pick a lane. Let me know what I’m dealing with already. These repeated facades of holding these mother fuckers to account is exhausting and deflating. What the fuck else do they need to show you? These fascists have so little regard for the law and the constitution that they would wipe their asses with Xinis’s robe if given the chance. 

But sure - go ahead and give them another week after demanding that “this ends now”.  Jesus Christ…

DT: "Let's just stall."

SC: "We don't have to make a determination and just let it float in legal limbo."
There’s a special place in hell for Trump and his enablers.
You're fucking kidding me
And still nothing happens.

posts.title: Detention officers arrested after retired K9 found dead
top_comments:
Oh, poor little boy. He died in his little house. Likely the only place he felt safe. Just looking for a tiny bit of love.

If I have only one wish it's for you Bane. May you live on in the eternal meadow. Where it is always the most beautiful day.
The dog staved to death lovked in a outdoor kennel with no food or water. He was dead at least a week
I always wonder what happens to retired police dogs. And while they are working- are they actually shown love? If they are retired, why not keep them?
I know we shouldn’t judge a book by its cover, but JFC. They look like two guys who would be arrested for killing a dog.
The former handler should be charged, too.

It takes a real special kind of awful to mistreat animals.

Gonna hug my little dude a little tighter tonight because I'm thankful for every day I have with him.
This is one of the saddest things I have read in a while.  Fuck these guys

>"According to court documents, the sheriff’s office received an anonymous tip that retired K9 Bane “was being neglected and abused” by Huffstetler.

>“The tip stated **Bane was living outside with no food, water, or shade,**” Sergeant Ashten Jackson stated in the affidavit.  
...  
“Detectives located K9 Bane deceased in a plastic dog house inside the outdoor kennel,” Jackson stated. “K9 Bane appears to have been deceased for a substantial amount of time.”

Between this and the post (about the scoliosis alligator) where someone mentioned a lion cub with a broken back left behind by its pack and desperately trying to crawl after them, I think I've had just about enough internet for today.

I'm not sure why the k9 handler let his son have the retired k9 officer, but I hope he has some remorse over that. Going to be you being neglected next. Poor dog. Locking up animals in small places and letting them starve to death through complete neglect has got to be some red flag for absolute fucking human garbage. Throw him in the trash.

posts.title: Maryland judge orders return of Venezuelan asylum seeker deported to El Salvador | CNN Politics
top_comments: Yes. Due process for every last person that we've sent. Every single human that we've deported there is protected under the constitution and the day we stop defending that is the day that we all surrender our own constitutional rights.
Add it to the list of shit they'll ignore because who's gonna do anything about it?
Donald Trump thinks that asylum means "insane asylum" and that's why he says it all the time. I really do believe this.
But have we looked at his tattoos. According to our gov, tattoos are the fundamental principle of fairness.

Order schmorder, you have no power over the king.

I HATE this timeline.
Trump: No, thanks for the suggestion though.

It's easy to forget but we sent a man with no due process, who was ordered to be PROTECTED by our courts... to a death camp.

The foundations of everything are fucked if the laws don't prevail.

> The Trump administration, according to the order, has argued Cristian’s deportation did not violate the settlement, asserting “his designation as an alien enemy pursuant to the AEA results in him ceasing to be a member” of the class action. The government invoked the Alien Enemies Act, an 18th-century wartime authority, on March 15 to deport alleged members of Tren de Aragua, a Venezuelan gang Trump accuses of “perpetrating an invasion of and predatory incursion into the United States.”
A sworn declaration from Robert Cerna, the ICE acting Field Office Director for Enforcement and Removal Operations, said Cristian had been arrested in Texas in January.
“On January 6, 2025, (‘Cristian’) was convicted in the 482nd District Court at Harris County, Texas, for the offense of possession of cocaine,” Cerna stated in the filing. Cerna added that Immigration and Customs Enforcement determined Cristian was subject to removal following the invocation of the AEA.

So he was deported to El Salvador when he was from Venezuela. Against orders of a legal settlement that gave him protection. To be placed in CECOT, but the only detailed claim against him is he had cocaine. Are we going to be arresting every college kid who does cocaine and tossing them in a US Supermax without due process? Due process must be upheld for all, or it is too easy for our government to incarcerate anyone on a whim.

Well, didn't the supreme court also order the return of the one wrongfully sent to El Salvador a while ago. Does anyone really believe that will happen?

The constitution crisis is here now. When an order of the supreme court is ignored, the house of cards is going to come crashing down because the only thing holding up our constitution is the belief that it should be. There is no real power being allocated to the judicial.
Can we use names. Whats this person's name?

posts.title: Judge rules federal government owes nearly $28 million to North Dakota for pipeline protests
top_comments:
>The sometimes-chaotic demonstrations drew international attention for the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe’s opposition to the pipeline’s Missouri River crossing upstream of the tribe’s reservation. The tribe has long opposed the pipeline, fearing an oil spill polluting its water supply.

And sure enough [the pipeline ruptured spilling 3,500 gallons of oil a couple weeks ago](https://www.kvrr.com/2025/04/08/update-3500-barrels-of-oil-spilled-after-keystone-pipeline-rupture-near-fort-ransom/) but good news for the cops who policed the protests I guess
“federal government owes state government millions for doing the violent suppression for them”
Dude they were using private security to set dogs on Native Americans. How fucked up is that. Those dogs weren’t even real cops.
Wow this is so corrupt it's ridiculous. Suing the government to pay the state for illegally using state law enforcement to break up a protest against a private company.

Why isn’t the company paying for this? Maybe if there was an actual economic impact to using your money and influence to lobby for projects in your favor. We’d see corporations less likely to engage in this kind of hell or high water engagement of local communities.
Which political party was in power in Feb 2017 when the protests were over  and it came time to pay up? What a mystery.
We’ve learned judges’ ruling are all toothless

This right here.

This.

This is sinclairs jungle.
Can't sue the government unless the government lets you.
Will the Trump administration pay it or will he just bitch and moan about how he wasn't president at the time?

TIL Benin is a country I'd never heard of.  Really gotta improve my knowledge of African geography.
Update: another attack happened today, this time an attack  on a French Supplied Vab.   key info is this happened in Borgu department which is far south of the attack which killed the 54 soldiers.

I read that there is a library in Timbuktu that has documents written in the middle ages that record local lore from before islam and christianity arrived and that a lot of them have never been translated. posts.title: Man charged with arson after authorities say he sparked New Jersey Pine Barrens fire
top_comments: tldr: it wasn't on purpose. dude had a bon fire and didn't extinguish it all the way before leaving. Fire flared back up and started to spread through the woods.
Obviously not an interior decorator.
It always amazes me that authorities are able to find people who start forest fires. Seems like it would be very hard to do.

If we held people financially accountable for this stuff (when it’s accidental but preventable and causes massive damage like this) I bet people would be a lot more careful. This is clearly accidental but from idiocy. Who the heck just walks away from a bonfire? It’s one thing if it’s your little patio thing that’s well contained and dying out. It’s another when you’re burning piles of rubbish in your yard

One of the issues that is missed by the news media is that this and many other ecosystems are supposed to burn regularly. I could write an essay on this, but the NJ Pine Barrens, just like the rest of the Atlantic Coast Pine Barrens, is a fire-dependent ecosystem. Plants and animals that live in this ecosystem rely on fire to maintain the habitat that they need to reproduce and thrive. Many require open habitat, like NJ's state reptile, the Bog Turtle. This species is also on the Endangered Species List and is considered Critically Endangered globally. 

The issue is, like many of the other fire-dependent ecosystems in the world, people built structures in them and then repressed the fire that was integral to the ecosystem. It wasn't until the 1990s and early 2000s that we realized how important fire is for ecosystems like this. But now they have a ton of fuel for fires, and they can easily catch on fire and rapidly spread. It's technically a natural and important part of the ecosystem, it's just we don't like when structures and timber trees burn.

Isn't that where the goodfellas buried the bodies back in the day?

https://www.nytimes.com/1973/02/05/archives/mob-favors-pinelands-for-burials.html
I wonder if Pauli's Russian made it out.
I hope so, I’ll never get that shoe back now!
Found Ongs hat. Fires a distraction.
Buddy is 5’7 and weighing 250 pounds, I’m surprised to see him outrun the fire.

posts.title: German beer sales down at home and abroad
top_comments:
>Non-alcoholic beer has, however, been seeing a huge increase in sales in Germany as those of alcoholic beverages fall.

People are just switching to non alcoholic drinks.

US brewer here: sales are down domestically too. Everyone across the board has pretty much been struggling since Covid to regain their footing, particularly with on-premise sales (draft accounts). Things just aren’t the same anymore, and demand is way down

Younger generations just aren’t drinking like previous generations also and, if they are drinking,  trends have shown beverages like Twisted Tea, seltzers, and session (or ‘mini’) beers that are sub 5% abv have been popular.
According to my bank account, yep. I used to buy about $200 in Weihensptephaner, Hofbrau, Spaten and Fruh every month. Now it's down to less than $100.
2024 and 2025 already feels like im drunk without having any beer.
Weed is legal in Germany, so that would track.
Personally I enjoy a good German pilsner or dunkel.  Craft breweries in the US only want to make IPAs.  I don't like IPAs, they hide any taste they might have behind way too much hops.
It’s because I quit drinking. Damn I miss German beer
Dab drinking Canadian here doing my part.  It’s the best beer for the low price here.

Trump: No, thanks for the suggestion though.

It's easy to forget but we sent a man with no due process, who was ordered to be PROTECTED by our courts... to a death camp.

The foundations of everything are fucked if the laws don't prevail.

> The Trump administration, according to the order, has argued Cristian’s deportation did not violate the settlement, asserting “his designation as an alien enemy pursuant to the AEA results in him ceasing to be a member” of the class action. The government invoked the Alien Enemies Act, an 18th-century wartime authority, on March 15 to deport alleged members of Tren de Aragua, a Venezuelan gang Trump accuses of “perpetrating an invasion of and predatory incursion into the United States.”
A sworn declaration from Robert Cerna, the ICE acting Field Office Director for Enforcement and Removal Operations, said Cristian had been arrested in Texas in January.
“On January 6, 2025, (‘Cristian’) was convicted in the 482nd District Court at Harris County, Texas, for the offense of possession of cocaine,” Cerna stated in the filing. Cerna added that Immigration and Customs Enforcement determined Cristian was subject to removal following the invocation of the AEA.

So he was deported to El Salvador when he was from Venezuela. Against orders of a legal settlement that gave him protection. To be placed in CECOT, but the only detailed claim against him is he had cocaine. Are we going to be arresting every college kid who does cocaine and tossing them in a US Supermax without due process? Due process must be upheld for all, or it is too easy for our government to incarcerate anyone on a whim.

The constitution crisis is here now. When an order of the supreme court is ignored, the house of cards is going to come crashing down because the only thing holding up our constitution is the belief that it should be. There is no real power being allocated to the judicial.

posts.title: Man charged with arson after authorities say he sparked New Jersey Pine Barrens fire
top_comments: tldr: it wasn't on purpose. dude had a bon fire and didn't extinguish it all the way before leaving. Fire flared back up and started to spread through the woods.
Obviously not an interior decorator.
It always amazes me that authorities are able to find people who start forest fires. Seems like it would be very hard to do.

If we held people financially accountable for this stuff (when it’s accidental but preventable and causes massive damage like this) I bet people would be a lot more careful. This is clearly accidental but from idiocy. Who the heck just walks away from a bonfire? It’s one thing if it’s your little patio thing that’s well contained and dying out. It’s another when you’re burning piles of rubbish in your yard

One of the issues that is missed by the news media is that this and many other ecosystems are supposed to burn regularly. I could write an essay on this, but the NJ Pine Barrens, just like the rest of the Atlantic Coast Pine Barrens, is a fire-dependent ecosystem. Plants and animals that live in this ecosystem rely on fire to maintain the habitat that they need to reproduce and thrive. Many require open habitat, like NJ's state reptile, the Bog Turtle. This species is also on the Endangered Species List and is considered Critically Endangered globally. 

The issue is, like many of the other fire-dependent ecosystems in the world, people built structures in them and then repressed the fire that was integral to the ecosystem. It wasn't until the 1990s and early 2000s that we realized how important fire is for ecosystems like this. But now they have a ton of fuel for fires, and they can easily catch on fire and rapidly spread. It's technically a natural and important part of the ecosystem, it's just we don't like when structures and timber trees burn.

Isn't that where the goodfellas buried the bodies back in the day?

https://www.nytimes.com/1973/02/05/archives/mob-favors-pinelands-for-burials.html
I wonder if Pauli's Russian made it out.
I hope so, I’ll never get that shoe back now!
Found Ongs hat. Fires a distraction.
Buddy is 5’7 and weighing 250 pounds, I’m surprised to see him outrun the fire.

posts.title: After a scathing rebuke, judge grants DOJ an extension in deportation case
top_comments: Yeah, sounds about right. Absolutely worthless.

To be clear, the lawyers representing Abrego Garcia *also* signed off on this pause. We don't know *what* the deal is, but the Trump administration floating something that apparently offered the possibility of resolution. We'll see what ultimately happens, but I don't think this is actually *bad* news, per se.

>"Defendants have failed to respond in good faith, and their refusal to do so can only be viewed as willful and intentional noncompliance," Xinis wrote.

>"That ends now," Judge Xinis declared as she rejected the administration's arguments so far as "specious" and condemned their "mischaracterization" of the Supreme Court's directive to facilitate Abrego Garcia's return to the U.S.

Judge Xinis should have clarified, "That ends...in another week". What a joke.

Because people are reading the headline and nothing more, she gave them a week because KILMAR'S ATTORNEYS AGREED TO IT. The government's attorneys filed something under seal, Kilmar's attorney replied to it, and then both sides agreed to push back the deadline a week.

A delay for what? We have Congress people going there. We have the creepy President of El Salvador coming here. We have Trump making many statements about how he refuses to comply with the Supreme Court. Do we just not care that democracy is dying? The man that our government said was mistakenly sent there, paid for by the US to be kidnapped and jailed in that country, could be back here tonight.

Soooo, “That ends now” meant…what, exactly?

For fuck sake - either just let this man turn into Hitler reincarnate or don’t. But fucking pick a lane. Let me know what I’m dealing with already. These repeated facades of holding these mother fuckers to account is exhausting and deflating. What the fuck else do they need to show you? These fascists have so little regard for the law and the constitution that they would wipe their asses with Xinis’s robe if given the chance. 

But sure - go ahead and give them another week after demanding that “this ends now”.  Jesus Christ…

DT: "Let's just stall."

SC: "We don't have to make a determination and just let it float in legal limbo."
There’s a special place in hell for Trump and his enablers.
You're fucking kidding me
And still nothing happens.

posts.title: German beer sales down at home and abroad
top_comments:
>Non-alcoholic beer has, however, been seeing a huge increase in sales in Germany as those of alcoholic beverages fall.

People are just switching to non alcoholic drinks.

US brewer here: sales are down domestically too. Everyone across the board has pretty much been struggling since Covid to regain their footing, particularly with on-premise sales (draft accounts). Things just aren’t the same anymore, and demand is way down

Younger generations just aren’t drinking like previous generations also and, if they are drinking,  trends have shown beverages like Twisted Tea, seltzers, and session (or ‘mini’) beers that are sub 5% abv have been popular.
According to my bank account, yep. I used to buy about $200 in Weihensptephaner, Hofbrau, Spaten and Fruh every month. Now it's down to less than $100.
2024 and 2025 already feels like im drunk without having any beer.
Weed is legal in Germany, so that would track.
Personally I enjoy a good German pilsner or dunkel.  Craft breweries in the US only want to make IPAs.  I don't like IPAs, they hide any taste they might have behind way too much hops.
It’s because I quit drinking. Damn I miss German beer
Dab drinking Canadian here doing my part.  It’s the best beer for the low price here.

Beer quality abroad has surged. 

I used to buy German beers because the purity laws gave me some confidence I wasn't just drinking a pint of preservatives sure to give me a mega hangover, but there's so many good local micro to medium sized brewers now, it makes more sense to support local businesses.
